p.s: A fact you can notcannot ignore.
He is smart while getting us, getting us to an opinion we had not support, maybe not even know.
And the way how he does this starts right at the beginning.
He starts with giving the reader a taste, a taste of his opponents?
No, he is giving a taste of what unions can be, what they have been.
With this he gives us the feeling that we have to fight back to stop the development of unions.
So he convinced us after 4 lines, without telling us his currently opinion.
We are getting so obsessed with the old versions of unions by he is using positevelypositively connoted words to let the old unions stand in a favourable light.
Examples are unions were successful in bringing these essential changes in line 4.
After the first part, while talking about todaystoday's unions, he is switching his communicative strategy to negatively connoted words to show the usefulness of todaystoday's unions.
Examples for this are phrasephrases like Unions are anticompetitiveness in line 10 to 11.
But his mainly used communicative strategy in the body part are ironysirony.
Pollard is using them to bring the reader to ask himself or herself is this not the exact reason why unions should provide and not do.
But he does not mean this as an irony he is meaning this serious with all his authority.
